questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have two Azure virtual machines that run SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES).

You plan to implement a highly available SAP HANA deployment.

You need to implement a STONITH block device (SBD) for the planned implementation.

What should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Answer is correct.
iSCSI devices require additional VM
It should be Storage account and iSCSI
C is No, since its Premium_LRS , only GRS are replicated across regions
Yes, No No, since its Premium_LRS , only GRS are replicated across regions

Yes, No, No
LRS will not replicate to another region
Yes, No, No. Storage will not be replicated to different regions since the storage type is Premium_LRS. Only GRS would be replicated.
C is no as it's Premium _LRS not GRS
the answer is Yes, No, No

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You plan to deploy two SAP NetWeaver landscapes named Production1 and Production2 to Azure. Production1 will contain an SAP NetWeaver central services (ASCS/SCS) instance hosted on a Windows failover cluster. Production2 will contain an SAP ASCS/SCS instance hosted on a Linux Pacemaker cluster.

You need to recommend a shared storage solution for each landscape. The solutions must meet the following requirements:

• Minimize administrative effort.
• Minimize costs.

What should you include in the recommendation? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Production 2: An Azure File share ( premium )
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sap/workloads/high-availability-guide-suse-nfs-azure-files?tabs=lb-portal%2Censa1

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/implement-high-availability-for-sap-workloads-azure/7-explore-high-availability-sap-ascs-scs-instances

A shared disk is not supported. A clustered shared disk is required which can be provided by third party solution like SIOS Data keep or you can use file share with help of scale out file server.

So answer is scale-out file server and Netapp files.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You plan to implement a highly available, three-tier deployment of an SAP NetWeaver landscape on Azure. The landscape will use SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES).

You need to implement the SAP NetWeaver central services (ASCS/SCS) tier.

What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
It should be Azure Netapp files and Pacemaker.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/implement-high-availability-for-sap-workloads-azure/7-explore-high-availability-sap-ascs-scs-instances

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You plan to deploy an SAP NetWeaver landscape that will use SQL Server on Azure virtual machines.

The database tier must meet the following requirements:

• Maintain database availability in the event of a single Azure datacenter failure.
• Maximize IOPS.

How should you configure the database tier? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//
